info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 09 at 5:57AM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Forest Service Sawtooth Avalanche Center. ...The Forest Service Sawtooth Avalanche Center in Ketchum Idaho has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING... * WHAT...The avalanche danger for the warning area is HIGH. * WHERE...The Sawtooth, Western Smoky, and Soldier Mountains, including the mountains near Stanley, Atlanta, Smiley Creek and Fairfield. The Backcountry Avalanche Warning does not apply to operating ski areas. * WHEN...in effect until 0400 MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...An intense winter storm bringing heavy snowfall and strong wind is overloading a very weak snowpack. Very dangerous avalanche conditions will develop by Tuesday afternoon. Human- triggered avalanches large enough to bury you are almost certain. Very large natural avalanches are expected. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Expect large natural avalanches in many areas. Some will be large enough to snap trees or destroy a wood frame house. Slides may run long distances into flat areas and mature forests. Avoid all avalanche terrain. Stay off of and out from below steep slopes - slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. Consult WWW.SAWTOOTHAVALANCHE.COM or WWW.AVALANCHE.ORG for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
